name: Selling rope in Kabul
description: After my combat tour in Vietnam, I took the long way home—took my cameras and traveled for a couple of years, through Southeast Asia, the Indian Subcontinent, the Middle East, and Europe, snapping photographs all the way (you can read my story at www.billslongwayhome.com).    “The Sellers” is a collection of photographs from my travels, a dozen glimpses of all kinds of vendors hard at work in markets, at carts, and on sidewalks all over the world.  Now, half a century later, as I share these in a digital marketplace full of artists hawking their wares, I hope these photos remind us all of the humanity behind the transactions. This photo was taken in beautiful Kabul, Afghanistan, circa 1970 (this was before the Russians and the Taliban left their mark on the country).  Kabul had very few fixed stores, so most goods were sold at stalls on the street.
